text.Tidus: Narration: Listen to my story. This may be our last chance.

text.ACTION: [crowd noise, fans run towards Tidus' house and wave as he emerges. Creepy Little Kid steps out of nowhere and joins crowd.]
Talking to fans on dock (all optional/missible dialog is indicated with gray background)

CHOICE.Woman w/nerdy specs: I've been a big fan of yours. From the very beginning!

CHOICE.Man with Spiderman jacket: Yeah! We're cheering for you! You're Jecht's son! I'd be crazy not to cheer for you!

CHOICE.Woman in long skirt: Are you gonna show us that shot tonight?
You should do it! For us! The Jecht Shot. I'll be waiting!

CHOICE.Bahamut's Fayth: The game tonight ... It's very important.

text.Tidus: Nothing to worry about! Oh, if I score a goal ... I'll do this! (raises arms) That will mean it was for you, okay?

text.ACTION: (Titter)

text.Woman in pink top: East block in the front row!

text.ACTION: (Holds up ball)

text.Kid w/dreads: Your floating house ... It's cool! Can I see inside next time?

text.ACTION: (Giggle)

text.Kid in Abes T-shirt: Hey, show me how to play!
I want to be a blitzer, too!

CHOICE.ACTION: (AKA "5th from the right")

CHOICE.Redheaded woman: Can I see you after the game?
Great! I know this great place ...

text.Tidus: Well, gotta go! Cheer for me!
Hey, I got a game to play!

text.Bahamut's Fayth: You can't tonight.

text.ACTION: (Three kids do odd bow / Yevon prayer)
[Tidus walks along, snorts at outdoor screen displaying Jecht's portrait.]

text.Zanar: I was in a coffee shop, running away from home when I heard the news. Our hero, Jecht, gone. Vanished into thin air! My dad must have been his biggest fan. I knew how sad he'd be. Heck, we all were that day. "Zanar," I says to myself, "What are you thinking?" I went running straight back home. We sat up talking 'bout Jecht all night. My dad and I never talked so much. Whoa ... Didn't mean to reminisce, folks. Anyway ... Ten years later, the Jecht Memorial Cup tournament is today! The two teams that have won through to the finals are ... of course, the Abes from A-East, and the Duggles from C-South. I know there's a lot of people out there today to see the star of the Abes! In just one year, he's become the team's number one player! He's Jecht's blood, and the new hope of blitzball! What kind of super play will he show us today? Will we see his father's legendary shot? I don't think I'm the only one excited here, folks!

text.ACTION: Talking with locals en route (A few clones. Later, the game tries to avoid having clones in same area.)

CHOICE.Guy in yellow pants: It's gonna be a killer game tonight. I know it! Tonight's game is gonna be one for the history books!

CHOICE.Guy in Spiderman jacket: You'd better hurry! The game can't start without you! Show us your moves out there, man!

CHOICE.Woman in pink top: Hurry up! The game's about to start! We're counting on you, ace!

CHOICE.Kid w/dreads: You'd better win tonight, or I'll deck you one! Pow! I wanna play on your team when I grow up, Tidus!

CHOICE.Man: They say you've got some tricks even your old man couldn't do! Dinner's on me if you win! I even saved a table for you.

CHOICE.Another guy in yellow pants: Well, well! If it isn't Jecht junior! From the look on your face, you'd think you already won!

CHOICE.Woman in pink top: Whoa ... I got the shivers. Maybe I'm coming down with something ... Do you feel cold? Nah, maybe it's just me. Never mind.

CHOICE.Woman in long skirt: Careful, the Zanarkand Duggles mean business tonight! I hear the Zanarkand Duggles play dirty!

CHOICE.Redhead: Hey, Mr. Star Player of the Abes! Do your stuff out there tonight! Their defense won't know what hit them!

CHOICE.Girl in pink top: Man, tickets for tonight's game cost an arm and a leg! The tickets were all sold out! I hope someone's got some extra. Can't you get me a ticket? I want to see the game up close.
R-Really? You're the greatest! How can I repay you? Here, have this! They'll let me in if I say "Tidus and I are buds," right? I won't tell anyone else. It'll be our secret!
Oh, well. It was worth a try. Aw, too bad ... I would have cheered for you. It's okay, really! I'll be fine here ... alone ...

CHOICE.Guy: I don't feel so good ... like I'm on a roller coaster going down. Maybe all this excitement's gotten to me.

CHOICE.Kid w/bandana: Hit 'em with a Jecht Shot, okay? Your dad was the best, Tidus. I wish I had a dad like yours!

CHOICE.Kid w/dreads: The Zanarkand Abes rule! My mom's a big fan of yours, too! She said to invite you to dinner!

CHOICE.Kid in Abes T-shirt: Good luck, Tidus! Come on, you're gonna be late! Hurry! Hurry!

CHOICE.Another guy in yellow pants: All of Zanarkand's watching now, so put on a show for 'em! Show them what blitzball's all about!

CHOICE.Another woman in long skirt: I'm sure you'll get MPV this year. You are Jecht's son, after all!

CHOICE.Another redhead: The Zanarkand Abes are counting on you! Don't let them down! You'd better hurry ... Or are you just trying to warm up the crowd?

text.ACTION: [Tidus shoves his way through admirers gathered outside]

text.Tidus: Make way, make way! Coming through, sorry! Hey, I'm gonna be late! Hey, let go of me!

text.ACTION: [Screaming spectators flee stadium like rats leaving sinking ship. Tidus staggers to feet, approaches figure leaning against rubble.]

text.Tidus: Auron! What are you doing here?

text.Auron: I was waiting for you. (Walks away)

text.ACTION: [Tidus staggers along, opposite direction from running people. There's a flash, and Creepy Little Kid appears.]
[For an instant the running figures and the whole city are frozen.]

text.Bahamut's Fayth: It begins.
Don't cry.

text.ACTION: [Flash of light. Kid vanishes. Movement/chaos resumes.]

text.Tidus: (Catches up to him) Hey, not this way!

text.ACTION: [Sinscales fall on road surround them. Tidus bats at monsters, falls down. Auron holds out sword.]

text.Tidus: (Takes sword, stands up, can barely lift it)

text.Auron: I hope you know how to use it.

text.ACTION: [First battle]

text.Auron: These ones don't matter. We cut through!

text.ACTION: [More Sinscales]

text.Auron: Don't bother going after all of them. Cut the ones that matter, and run!

text.ACTION: [Boss Fight: Tentacles]
[They run up the road past the viewscreen with Jecht]

text.Tidus: What are you laughing at, old man?
Auron! Let's get out of here!

text.ACTION: [Fight: surrounded by even more Sinscales]

text.Auron: That–knock it down! (Points at contraption — "Tanker" — against curb)

text.ACTION: [Knock down tanker, triggering explosion]
[Both run. Tidus leaps as road collapses and catches far side, dangling by hands.]
(Disembodied voice)
[Tidus swims towards fuzzy image of Jecht standing on platform. Jecht turns into Tidus as a child.]

text.Tidus: Narration: I thought about a lot of things… like where I was, what I’d got myself into. I started to feel light-headed… and then, sleepy. I think I had a dream. A dream of being alone. I wanted someone– anyone, beside me… so I didn’t have to feel alone anymore.

text.ACTION: [Tidus wakes up on pile of half-submerged rubble. Lightning flickers over large structure in distance.]
[Tidus swims towards structure]

text.Tidus:
Sphere lying in lefthand ruins:
=Introduction to Al Bhed=
Find Al Bhed primers to help you decipher the strange Al Bhed language. Master the Al Bhed language! Best of luck!

On blue plaque in righthand ruins:
In the land where bolts of light
illuminate the blackest night
With Macalania behind
the fourth pillar you sight
look not on the left
but on the right
What do we have here? Nope. Can't read it.

text.ACTION: [Boss Fight with underwater monster, which almost swallows him.]
[Tidus flees into tunnel which collapses behind him.]

text.Tidus: Narration: I had made it out of the frying pan…and into the freezer. I thought I was going to die in this place.

text.ACTION: [Gets a fire lit]
(Dozes off.)
[A shadow skitters around upper level. Tidus awakens, discovers fire's dying.]

text.Tidus: Hey, wait! Wait! Don't go out on me! Just hold on. I'll get more wood!

text.ACTION: [Monster attacks. Boss battle.]
[Five Al Bhed arrive. Rikku helps.]
[They finish off monster]
[Bearded Al Bhed grabs Tidus.]

text.Rikku: Wait! What if it is human?

text.Gas mask guy: They are the same in death.

text.Rikku: I forbid it! We bring it with us.
(Walks up to Tidus, whispers ... ) Sorry. (Thwack)

text.ACTION: [Tidus wakes up and starts to rise]
(Thwack)
[Brother comes on deck with Rikku]
Rikku hoists Tidus to his feet, Brother gestures vigorously, mimes diving and swimming]
(Hands Tidus a breather and mimes for him to put it on)
(Thwack)

text.Rikku: Wait
He said you can stay if you make yourself useful.

text.ACTION: (Thwack)
[Tidus peers at machinery folded on starboard rear deck]

CHOICE.Tidus: What's this? Some kind of crane?

CHOICE.Brother: Hey, you! Get away from there!

CHOICE.Tidus: All right, all right! You don't have to shout!

CHOICE.Brother: Move it! Get to work, immediately!

CHOICE.Keyakku: If you're near death, really near death, use this! Go on, earn your pay.

CHOICE.Gas mask guy: You afraid of the sea? Weakling!

text.Rikku: Oh, almost forgot!

text.ACTION: [Sphere Grid Tutorial]
After Sphere Grid Tutorial…

text.Rikku: We found some ancient ruins right beneath us. It's not active now, but there should still be some power left. We're gonna go down there and activate it ... and then we should be able to salvage the big prize!
Okay! Let's get to work!

text.ACTION: If Tidus climbs back aboard…

CHOICE.Rikku: We'll go as soon as you're ready!

CHOICE.Keyakku: will give more potions every time you re-surface!

text.ACTION: [Tidus and Rikku power up ruins, fight Nautilus, glimpse airship on sea bottom.]

text.Al Bhed in blue cap: Now, how to drag it up?

text.ACTION: (attempts to follow them below)
(Thwack)

text.Tidus: Hey! Hey, I helped out, didn't I?

text.ACTION: [Fast forward, Tidus lying on deck.]

text.Rikku: (Wakes him with a kick, puts down tray of food)

text.Tidus: Whoa! Right on! (Gobbles too fast, chokes)

text.Rikku: Hey! (Offers canteen) It's 'cause you eat too fast!
Hey!

text.Tidus: Hello there. What is your name?

text.Rikku: Rikku.

text.Tidus: Whoa! You really do understand! Why didn't you say so earlier?

text.Rikku: I didn't get a chance to! Everyone thought oui were a fiend.
Oh, "oui" means "you."

text.Tidus: Um ... Who are you guys, anyway?

text.Rikku: We're Al Bhed. Can't you tell?
Wait. You're not an Al Bhed-hater, are you?

text.Tidus: I don't even know what an Al Bhed is.

text.Rikku: Where are you from?

text.Tidus: Zanarkand. I'm a blitzball player. Star player of the Zanarkand Abes!

text.Rikku: Did you hit your head or something?
Oh, right ... Do you remember anything before that?

text.Tidus: Narration: So I told her everything there was to tell about Zanarkand…About life there, blitzball, and Sin’s attack…and about how Auron and I were engulfed in this light. I just said things as they came to mind. But then I started to wonder.

text.Rikku: You were near Sin.
Don't worry, you'll be better in no time. They say your head gets funny when Sin is near. Maybe you just had some kind of dream?
Because of Sin's toxin, yeah.
Yeah, there is no Zanarkand anymore. Sin destroyed it a thousand years ago. So ... no one plays blitzball there.

text.Tidus: Huh?! What do you mean, a thousand years ago? But I saw Sin attack Zanarkand! You're saying that happened a thousand years ago? No way!

text.Rikku: You said ... You play blitzball?
You know, you should go to Luca. Someone might know who you are, or you might find someone you recognize.
(groans)
(wanders around a bit, then pats his shoulder) Okay, leave it to me! I'll get you to Luca, promise!
(laughs) You'd rather stay here?
Okay, I'll go tell the others. Wait here.
Oh, and one thing. Don't tell anyone you're from Zanarkand, okay? Yevon says it's a holy place. You might upset someone.
Hm.

text.ACTION: [Rikku leaves him alone on deck ... ]

text.Tidus: Narration: My Zanarkand, some kind of holy place? Yeah right, I thought. Since when?
Narration: Yevon? Sin? Luca? I thought Sin just took me to a faraway place, that I could go back in a day or two. But a thousand years into the future?

text.ACTION: [Ship shakes ... ]
[Al Bhed rush on deck]
[Wave sweeps Tidus overboard]
[Tidus wakes up spluttering]
[smacked by flying object]
[Wakka and Aurochs wave from beach]

text.Wakka: Hey! You okay?

text.Tidus: Heeey! (Waves back and shows off "Sphere Shot")

text.ACTION: [Tidus swims ashore. Gatta and Luzzu run off. Aurochs surround him.]

text.Wakka: You wanna try that move one more time?

text.Tidus: Narration: (fistpump) Finally, things were starting to look up. (demonstrates)

text.Wakka: You're no amateur. Who you play for?
What team you say again?

text.Tidus: Uh, I meant ... Forget that. I got too, uh ... close to Sin and my head's all foggy-like. So I don't know where this place is. Or even where I came from.

text.Wakka: Sin's toxin got to you. But, you're still alive. Praise be to Yevon!

text.ACTION: (Yevon bow)
(To Aurochs)

text.Wakka: All right, back to practice!

text.ACTION: (To Tidus)

text.Wakka: I'm Wakka, coach and captain of the Besaid Aurochs, brudda.

text.ACTION: (shakes hands)

text.Wakka: What? You hungry? Okay! Back to the village. I'll get you somethin'!

text.ACTION: If Tidus talks to Aurochs on the beach ...

CHOICE.Keepa: Hey, I'll admit it, we're not the best blitzers in Spira. "To do our best!" That's our motto. Guess it's not enough, though. Here, take this. And do your best, ya? We're always top dogs for the first few minutes of the game, ya? Then we start to run out of breath. That's when they get us. But Cap'n Wakka, man, he don't stop! No halftime breath for him, ya? He just keeps going!

CHOICE.Jassu: That shot was spectacular, brudda! Wish I could shoot like that.

CHOICE.Wakka: Cap'n Wakka's waiting for you. You better get going, ya? There's fiends on the road, ya? Use this if you get into trouble.

CHOICE.Datto: I gotta stop closing my eyes when the ball comes down.

CHOICE.Wakka: You being a blitzball player's probably what saved you out there. The best players–they can hold their breath, like, forever! I wish I could do that.
We had an underwater race once, ya? To see how long we could go. Two laps and we were out, but Cap'n Wakka went five, no sweat!
That toxin's nasty stuff, ya? You should go rest up. What am I saying? Take this, it might help!

CHOICE.Letty: I can head the ball pretty good. Today's just a bad day, ya?

CHOICE.Wakka: This is really weird, ya? I could do five in a row yesterday!
I'm nowhere near Cap'n Wakka, but I can hold my own underwater, ya? It's just that ... I'm not so good with the ball.
It true that the best players can even sleep underwater? Man, that's like ... superhuman, you know?

CHOICE.Botta: I really want to make Cap'n Wakka proud at this year's tournament.

CHOICE.Wakka: Come practice with us once the toxin wears off, okay? Hope you get better soon, brudda.

text.Tidus: Narration: I felt like I could trust this Wakka, so I just had to ask.
It's true Zanarkand was destroyed, right? A thousand years ago? So it's just a big pile of rubble now, isn't it?

text.Wakka: Long time ago, there were a whole lot of cities in Spira. Big cities with machina–machines–to run 'em. People played all day and let the machina do the work. And then, well, take a look.

text.ACTION: [view switches briefly to beach, ruins poking up through rainforest]

text.Wakka: Sin came, and destroyed the machina cities. And Zanarkand along with 'em. Yeah, that was about a thousand years ago, just like you said. If you ask me, Sin's our punishment for letting things get out of hand. What gets me, though ... is we gotta suffer, 'cause of what some goofballs did way back when! 'Course, we must always repent for our sins! That's important! It's just that, it's hard to keep at it sometimes, you know?

text.Tidus: Narration: It was just as Rikku said. Wakka and Rikku couldn’t both be lying. Why would they?

text.Wakka: (Guffaws) But you from the Zanarkand Abes–that was a good one! Hey, I'm not saying the team never existed, ya? But you gotta figure a team livin' in luxury like that'd be pretty soft, eh?

text.Tidus: Narration: I appreciated the fact that Wakka was trying to cheer me up. But at that time, all I could think about was… everything that happened to me–all this–started with Sin. Maybe if I could find Sin one more time, I could go home! For now, I’d just live life until that time came. No more worrying about where, or when, I was. Sure, it was hard not to think of home. But I started to feel better already. A little better…maybe.

text.Wakka: Hey! It's this way!

text.ACTION: [Wakka leads Tidus to cliff overlooking river]

text.Wakka: (Slaps his butt)

text.ACTION: [They swim downriver a while]

text.Wakka: (laughs, sneaks up behind T. and grabs in headlock)
Got a favor to ask ya.

text.Tidus: You want me on your team, right?

text.Wakka: (Lets go) A major blitz tournament's coming up. All the teams in Spira'll be there! It's so huge, I'm sure someone there will recognize you! Then you can go back to your old team, right? It'll be fun! What do you say, huh? Come on, come on!
Dude! Our team is gonna rock, eh?

text.Tidus: Narration: I thought then that blitzball and Sin were the only two things that Spira and Zanarkand had in common. I wasn’t too far off, either.

text.ACTION: [Wakka points at Besaid village spread out below them]

text.Wakka: This is where I was born. I started blitz when I was five. I joined the Aurochs at thirteen ... ten years ago.Ten years ... and we never won a game. Well, after last year's tournament, I quit. Time seemed right.
So, after quitting, I got this new job, ya? But every time my mind wandered, I thought about the game.

text.Tidus: Ten years without a single win'll do that.

text.Wakka: (Grunts) My first match last year was my big chance. But something else was on my mind. I couldn't focus.
Hey, hey!

text.Tidus: So you want to win the next tournament–go out with a bang.

text.Wakka: (Nods)
I don't care how we do. Long as we play our best. If we give it our all, I can walk away happy.

text.Tidus: No, no, no, no, no. If I say, "What's our goal?" you say, "Victory!" When you play in a blitzball tournament, you play to win!

text.Wakka: Victory? You serious?

text.ACTION: If Tidus tries the path back to the river before entering the village, his stomach grumbles and he changes his mind.

CHOICE.Wakka: it's an ancient custom. People leaving the island pray here for a safe trip. They say it works pretty good.

text.Luzzu: Ah, the one from the sea! : Be on guard. There're fiends on the road today! Luzzu: After surviving your run-in with Sin, 'twould be a shame if something happened now.

text.Gatta: Ah, the one from the sea! : Be on guard. There're fiends on the road today! Luzzu: After surviving your run-in with Sin, 'twould be a shame if something happened now.

text.ACTION: [Luzzu and Gatta head towards village]

text.Wakka: Luzzu and Gatta–Crusaders.
What, you forgot that too?
Hey, sorry. Don't worry about it. I'll help you out.

text.Tidus: In return, come tournament time, I'll make sure we take the cup!

text.Wakka: Cool! About the Crusaders, you can ask them yourself. They've got a lodge in the village.
Besaid Village.
We'll get you something over there later. Take a look around first. Let's see ... The Crusaders Lodge is over yonder. Luzzu and Gatta are usually there.

text.ACTION: (Points)

text.Wakka: Hm.
Oh, right.

text.ACTION: (Beckons)

text.Wakka: Over here!
You do remember the prayer, right?

CHOICE.Tidus: Narration: I didn’t know it in the first place, to tell the truth.

CHOICE.Wakka: Man, that's like the basics of the basics. Alright. I'll show you.

CHOICE.Tidus: Narration: Of course I’d never prayed before in my life. Not that he would know that…

CHOICE.Wakka: You ... must have forgot or something. Here, I'll show you.

text.Wakka: (Yevon bow in slow-motion) Go ahead, you try.
Hey, not bad. (slaps shoulder) Okay, now go present yourself to the temple summoner. (Leaves)

text.Tidus: Narration: Any blitzball player would know that prayer. It was the blitzball sign for victory.

text.ACTION: [Tidus finds Gatta and Luzzu at a table poring over chart]

text.Gatta: Hey, you! You were attacked by Sin ... right? Recently was it?
So, Sin can't be far, right? You're not hiding anything, are you?

text.Luzzu: If Sin's nearby, it'll attack the island for sure. But it hasn't. I wonder why?

text.Tidus: I'm sorry. I really don't know anything. To tell the truth, I don't even know what the Crusaders are.

text.Luzzu: Sin! The toxin! Gatta, tell him who we are!

text.ACTION: (stands, salutes)

text.Gatta: The Crusaders are sworn to battle Sin! We have chapters throughout Spira, accepting all who wish to join our struggle! The hero Mi'ihen formed the Crusaders eight hundred years ago as the Crimson Blades. Later, our ranks grew and we called ourselves the Crusaders. We've been fighting Sin ever since!

text.Tidus: What, you've been fighting eight hundred years and you still haven't beat it?

text.ACTION: (Stammers)

text.Luzzu: Well, we've steered Sin away from towns many times! And that's all we can do. Nobody's ever been able to defeat it. Our mission as Crusaders is to protect the temples, towns, villages, and people of Spira.

text.Tidus: So then whose job is it to defeat Sin?

text.Gatta: Is Sin's toxin really this bad, sir?

text.Luzzu: We could just tell you, but I think it better for you to try and remember. Go pray at the temple. Perhaps Yevon will help you regain your memory.

text.Gatta: But soon, we may be able to finally defeat Sin. We've got a plan–one that'll go down in Crusader history!

CHOICE.Luzzu: We've been excommunicated from Yevon. We must go, now. Everything is riding on our next ... our last battle!

CHOICE.Note: In Besaid Village, there's one of each NPC model, and you can follow them around if you're really patient. They say different things in different parts of the village. My nicknames are based on comments they drop at different times.

CHOICE.Gramps: I heard the Sin toxin got to you. Took your memory, eh? I'd be happy to teach you anything you've forgotten, sonny.

CHOICE.Luzzu: How could you forget Sin? I can't say I don't envy you, though. There's many who would give anything to forget the pain Sin has brought. Sin appeared a thousand years ago, a raging demon intent on reducing Spira to rubble. Everyone in Spira lives under Sin's shadow. But to forget Sin ... well, I'd consider yourself lucky, eh? Something else you'd like to know, eh?

The foul vapors that boil from Sin's hide are evil indeed ... One breath, and it will taint the very core of your body. People who get too close to Sin forget even the most important things. Just like you, eh? Something else you'd like to know, eh?

How wretched you must be, to have forgotten the teachings of Yevon! The teachings are the only salvation for those who suffer becasuse of Sin. I'm sure you followed the teachings, before the toxin got to you, of course. Go pray at the temple, and all will return in time. Something else you'd like to know, eh?

Zanarkand was once a great city in the far north of this land. Now it lies in a ruin, destroyed by Sin a thousand years ago. Such was its punishment for relying too much on machina. Something else you'd like to know, eh?

CHOICE.Tidus: No, thanks, I'll pass. [after receiving at least one answer, becomes ... ] No thanks, gramps.

CHOICE.Gramps: Maybe if I remind you of some things, you'll remember who you are! (Menu opens again)

CHOICE.Old woman: Me favorite's Lord Ohalland, ya? Spitting image of me old hubby.

CHOICE.Yuna's friend: Who are you, mister? Where you from?

CHOICE.Handyman: Sin's struck Besaid Village so many times I lost count. After this house got hit I guess the owner just let it be.

CHOICE.Luzzu: Sin will just come back and destroy it again. Sometimes I wonder why I bother.

CHOICE.Priestess: Besaid's devotion to the teachings of Yevon is commendable. Still, there is much for a priestess such a I to teach them.

CHOICE.Sailor: Is it true that Sin showed up near here? Oh boy! And the S.S. Liki's scheduled to leave any day now.

CHOICE.Portly Crusader: You should try praying. It worked for me–it'll work for you, too.

CHOICE.Vilucha's son: I can't figure out whether I'm gonna join the Aurochs or the Crusaders! I'm pretty good at blitz, ya? I can hold my breath and everything!

CHOICE.Girl with doggie: You're the talk of the town, you know? Word travels fast in a village this size.

CHOICE.Weaver: On a hot day like today, it's best to be in the shade, ya?

CHOICE.Refugee: I travelled Spira looking for a land where nobody had heard of Sin. I ... I gave up looking. I think it's for the best.

CHOICE.Journeyman weaver: Sin's toxin? Nah, you don't look sick. You must not have breathed in much of the stuff, ya? Guess being a blitz player means you can hold your breath pretty good.

CHOICE.Luzzu: I wanted to be a blitzer way back when. I just couldn't hold my breath.

CHOICE.Fabric merchant: The Besaid fabrics they make here are famous all over Spira! If I buy cheap and sell high, I'll be rolling in Gil in no time!

CHOICE.Pious woman: Yevon's teachings are our staff and our guide in life. Without the teachings, we'd just live every day in fear of Sin.

CHOICE.Luzzu: It ... It's like we were born to live in fear.

CHOICE.ACTION: If Tidus tries to leave village ...

CHOICE.Gatekeeper: Fiends are around even during the day. Take care not to travel alone, ya?

CHOICE.Luzzu: You know it's too dangerous. Sorry, but you can't pass.

CHOICE.Vilucha: Odd clothes you got. What land you from? This your first time to Besaid? We don't get many strangers here. I remember every visitor we get.

CHOICE.Vilucha's son: Daddy doesn't play with me at all.

CHOICE.Daddy the fisherman: You're the guy from the sea, right? I heard about you from Sir Luzzu.

CHOICE.Wakka: Go present yourself to the temple summoner before we eat, ya? A little praying might do your memory some good!

CHOICE.Luzzu: Mainlanders love the fabrics we weave here in Spira.

(trying to bounce ball on head) Yaah! Haah! Arrrgh!

CHOICE.Letty: Should I practice kick passes too?
Okay, I'll pretend I'm kicking with my hands!
I'm gonna sharpen my hand skills!

CHOICE.ACTION: In the wheelhouse ...

CHOICE.Captain: Ocean weather can be fickle, but I doubt we'll see any storms today. Of course, there is one thing worse than any storm, and its coming cannot be foretold ...
The cargo that the Crusaders loaded on board worries me. It better not be anything sacrilegious.

CHOICE.Helmsman: So, you're with Lady Yuna? That means you're a guardian. Hmm ... I guess I shouldn't judge a book by its cover.
Maybe I'll go have chat [sic] with Lady Yuna, too.

text.ACTION: [Tidus joins Yuna with feigned nonchalance. Both move to railing. Awkward silence.]
[Finally both start laughing. Flash forward; evidently they talked a bit.]

text.Yuna: You're a blitzball player, aren't you? From Zanarkand, right?

text.Tidus: Uh ... You hear that from Wakka?
Ah ... Wakka. Wakka doesn't believe me at all.

text.Yuna: I've heard, in Zanarkand ... there is a great stadium, all lit up even at night!
Great blitzball tournaments are held there, and the stands are always full!
A man named Jecht told me. He was my father's guardian.

text.Tidus: My father ... his name is Jecht!

text.Yuna: You know, our meeting like this must be the blessing of Yevon!

text.Tidus: (Dubious) Sounds like him, but it can't be him.
My old man, he died. Ten years ago, off the coast of Zanarkand.
He went out to sea for training one day ... and never came back. And no one's seen him since then.

text.Yuna: Why, that's the day that Jecht came to Spira.
It's true! I first met Jecht ten years and three months ago! I remember, that was the day my father left. The date fits, doesn't it?

text.Tidus: Ehh ... ha, ha ... Yeah, but how would he get here?

text.Yuna: You're here, are you not? (smiles, then nods eagerly as he smiles back)

text.ACTION: [Sudden rumble, Yuna thrown to deck. Tidus can't hold her but Kimahri catches her.]

text.Wakka: What do you think you're doing? Stick a harpoon in it and we'll all get dragged under!

text.2nd harpooner: Sin is going for Kilika! We gotta distract it! Harpooner 1: Our families are on Kilika! Forgive us, Lady Summoner!

text.ACTION: [The sailors fire harpoons towards Sin ... ]

text.Wakka: Wait! Oh, boy ...

text.ACTION: [Boss Battle with Sinscales and Fin]
Battle dialog, depending on who's in party ...

text.Tidus: How many of these things are there!?

text.Wakka: This place is crawling!

text.Lulu: The fin! That's where they're coming from.

text.Wakka: The fin! Attack the fin!

text.Tidus: What? We hit the fin first?

text.ACTION: [Finish off fin]
[Tidus swept overboard. Rescued by Wakka.]
[Yuna kneels over Tidus who lies on deck. Sky is sunset colors now.]

text.Tidus: Narration: When Sin attacked Zanarkand that day, I woke up in Spira. I kept hoping it would work in reverse, too.

text.Yuna: I will defeat Sin ... I must defeat Sin.

text.Tidus: Narration: I was just fooling myself. Maybe it was that day… on the sea, under the burning sun, I started to give up hope. I was in a foreign world. I wasn’t going home. This was my new reality, and I was stuck in it for good.

text.ACTION: [Yuna rushes out of ship. Middle-aged couple meet her on the dock.]

text.Yuna: Greetings! I am the summoner Yuna. I have come from the temple in Besaid.
If there is no other summoner here, please allow me to perform the sending.

text.Middle-aged man: Thanks be to ye! Woman: Our loved ones ... We feared they would become fiends!

text.ACTION: [The couple leads Yuna, Lulu and Kimahri away. Tidus and Wakka disembark.]

text.Wakka: We'll go see what we can do to help in town. (Leads Aurochs away)

text.ACTION: [Tidus finds crowd on lefthand path, approaches Lulu.]

text.Tidus: Uh, what's a "sending"? Are we going somewhere?

text.ACTION: (huff!)

text.Lulu: You truly are clueless. Are you sure it's just your memory that's the problem?

The dead need guidance. Filled with grief over their own death, they refuse to face their fate. They yearn to live on, and resent those still alive. You see, they envy the living. And in time, that envy turns to anger, even hate. Should these souls remain in Spira, they become fiends that prey on the living. Sad, isn't it?
The sending takes them to the Farplane, where they may rest in peace.
Mm. (Nods)

text.ACTION: [Yuna returns to dock; villagers surround her.]

text.Tidus: It must be tough, being a summoner.

text.Lulu: Yuna chose her own path. She knew from the beginning what it meant. All we can do is protect her along the way. Until the end.
(Silence)
(Nods slightly to Yuna, then throws hands in the air with a huff and leaves Tidus) Until she defeats Sin.
(Embraces Yuna)

text.Yuna: I hope ... I hope I did okay.

text.Lulu: You did very well! They've reached the Farplane by now. But ... (Strokes hair) no tears next time, hm?

text.Tidus: Narration: I wished there would never be a next time. No more people being killed by Sin. No more sendings for Yuna. Everyone stood there watching her. It was strange, and somehow…horrifying. I never wanted to see it again.

text.ACTION: [Fade to black. Tidus wakes up next morning in inn.]

text.ACTION: [Tidus comes outside]

text.Datto: runs by: Hey! You awake? Cap'n Wakka's waitin' for you!

CHOICE.Shirtless man: Everything is in shambles. I don't know where to start.

CHOICE.Second old man: Our loved ones made it to the Farplane with Lady Yuna's help. We are truly grateful for Yevon's blessing.

CHOICE.Lulu: I'm sure my grandchildren made it to the Farplane in peace.

CHOICE.Grieving woman: I wanted to believe it was just a bad dream. That this was all a dream and when I opened my eyes, everything would be back to normal. But, when morning came, nothing had changed.

CHOICE.Lulu: Daddy ...

CHOICE.Lulu: Hey, I may not even be from around here. Maybe I come from someplace far away ... Who knows?

CHOICE.Old woman: Hey, you! Hands off the merchandise! Oh, you're a customer, are you?

text.ACTION: [Tidus finds Wakka supervising repairs]

text.Wakka: Ah, there you are!
Besaid Aurochs! Huddle!
On to the temple, where we pray for victory!
High Summoner Ohalland used to live in the Kilika temple here. Yep, Lord Ohalland was once a great blitzer, you know?
Hm?

text.Tidus: Praying for victory's all good ... but is this right?

text.Wakka: Something wrong with enjoying blitzball?

This is the only time! The players fight with all their strength; the fans cheer for their favorite team. They forget pain, suffering ... Only the game matters! That's why blitz has been around for so long. Least that's what I think.
Let's play ... and win! Right?
(Turns and points) Temple's beyond the jungle there. Let's go!

text.ACTION: [Tidus and Wakka find the others waiting. Wakka heads to Lulu.]

text.Wakka: What's up?

text.Lulu: (To Tidus) Yuna's saying she wants you with us.

text.Yuna: (Smiling) I want to ask you to be my guardian.

text.Wakka: Yuna! What? This is no times for jokes, ya?
He may be a blitzball whiz kid, but up against fiends, he's a newbie.

text.Yuna: (Stops smiling) Not a guardian, then ... I just want him nearby.

text.Wakka: Wha?! (screws up face)

text.Lulu: We're all going to the temple anyway. Can't this wait till later?

text.Yuna: (Smiles and nods, turns back to T.) I'm sorry. I shouldn't have ...

text.Tidus: There's nothing to be sorry about. I'm just not really sure what's going on.

Normally, it's a skill that weakens enemies and heals the user. But when a Ronso uses it, that Ronso can sometimes learn fiends' abilities.

Are you heading for Kilika Temple? Then just follow this trail. There arre poisonous fiends in the forest. Be on your guard!
I'd steer clear of Ochu, Lord of the Wood. It's a powerful fiend even we Crusaders avoid.

Fiends are everywhere. Never let your guard down.

text.Wakka: O-ho! These stone steps have a history, you know? Yep, Lord Ohalland trained here at his peak.
Mm.

text.ACTION: [The guys line up]

text.Wakka: Yuna, if you would.

text.Yuna: (Raises arm) Ready? (Drops arm, runs ahead giggling)

text.Wakka: Hey! Hey!

text.ACTION: After Yuna cheats in the "race" ...

text.Lulu: Kids ...

text.ACTION: [Tidus runs up the steps ... ]

text.Wakka: Everyone, quick! Sinspawn!

text.ACTION: Possible dialog during battle with boss: Geneaux ...

text.Tidus: It's hard as rock! My sword's no good!

text.Wakka: My ball can't hurt it either! How 'bout magic!?

text.Lulu: Its tentacles absorb any spell cast at its body!

text.ACTION: [They kill the overgrown escargot]

text.Wakka: Sorry about that! Hoped to break you in a little slower.
You handled yourself pretty well. You got talent.

text.Lulu: Fiends. They fall from Sin's body, and are left behind in its wake.

text.Wakka: Leave 'em alone, and Sin comes back for 'em. You gotta be quick!

text.Tidus: Narration: That moment when Wakka told me I had talent in battle… I think that was when I started seriously considering becoming a guardian.

text.ACTION: [Party resumes climbing stairs]

text.Wakka: So, uh ... they got fiends in Zanarkand, too?

text.Tidus: Just a few. It's a big deal when one shows up, though.
Hey! Since when have you believed me about Zanarkand, anyway?

text.Wakka: I been thinking. Maybe people Sin gets to don't die. Maybe Sin carries 'em through time. Like a thousand years through time. And then one day, maybe they just pop back, see?

text.Lulu: (Shakes head) Amazing. Simply amazing.

text.Wakka: Hm?

text.Lulu: You make up one theory after another, refusing to face the simple truth. Sin didn't take Chappu anywhere. Sin crushed him and left him on the Djose shore! Your brother won't just pop back.

Oh, and one more thing. No matter how much you want it, no one can take Chappu's place. No one can replace Sir Jecht, for that matter. And there's no replacement for Lord Braksa, either. It's pointless to think about it, and sad.

text.ACTION: (Storms off; Yuna follows)

text.Wakka: (Sits) I ... I could never be what Chappu was. (Slams down fist)
Well, stuff happens. Best not to worry.

text.Tidus: Narration: Wakka, Lulu, and Wakka’s brother Chappu. Something had happened between them a long time ago, I was sure of it. Well, whatever it was, it was none of my business, that’s for sure. Best not to go there.

text.Datto: You sure are talented, man. Playing blitzball and fighting like that!

text.Lulu: I came here last year to fight for victory, but we lost in the first round. I guess I didn't pray hard enough, ya?

CHOICE.Tourist: I heard famous people come here. Where could they be?

CHOICE.Handyman: I hear the Crusaders are going to fight Sin without the aid of a summoner. Heh, they've got another thing coming. Haven't they ever heard of divine retribution?

CHOICE.Woman leaving: I've had enough of Kilika. Too many tearful memories here. We came to visit the temple one last time before we leave for good.

CHOICE.Young man leaving: We've decided to leave Kilika, and look for a place without Sin. Who knows if we'll ever find it.

text.Wakka: You here to pray for victory, too?

text.Bickson: Us? Pray? Who needs to pray? The Luca Goers always win!

text.Wakka: Oh, yeah? Then why are you here?

text.Graav: We've been praying for some competition this year!

text.Bickson: So what's your goal this time? You gonna "do your best" again? Ha! It's too bad your best isn't good enough! Why even bother showing up?

text.Tidus: This time, we play to win!

text.Bickson: Oooh! Play away! Just remember even kids can play, boys.

text.ACTION: [Goers saunter off]

text.Wakka: See you in the finals!

text.Tidus: We'll beat them. We have to!
Putting people down ... They're as bad as my old man!

text.Yuna: But, Sir Jecht was a kind and gentle man!

text.Wakka: Lord Ohalland, guide our feet.

text.ACTION: [Dona and Barthello emerge from Cloister]

text.Yuna: My name is Yuna– from the Isle of Besaid.

text.Barthello: Dona. Dona: So, you're High Summoner Braska's daughter. That's quite a name to live up to. Dona: My, my, my ... And all these people are your guardians? My, what a rabble! As I recall, Lord Braska had only two guardians. Quality over quantity, my dear. Whatever were you thinking? I have need of only one guardian. Right, Barthello? : (nods)

text.Yuna: I only have as many guardians as there are people I can trust. I trust them all with my life! To have so many guardians is a joy, and an honor! Even more so than being my father's daughter. Of course, I would never think of questioning your ways, either. So, Lady Dona, I ask of you: please leave us in peace.

text.Dona: You do what you want. Barthello, we're leaving.

text.Tidus: Narration: A guardian is someone a summoner can rely on. Someone she can trust with her life. I wondered, did Yuna feel that way about me?

text.Yuna: (Clasps hands shyly and smiles at T.)

text.ACTION: Blizters' comments after Dona leaves ...

text.Nizarut: Yeah! Teamwork and trust are key elements for both guardians and blitzers!

CHOICE.Deim: Are you a blitzer? Or a guardian? Don't tell me you're both!

text.Wakka: The fayth is below. Let's do it!

text.Lulu: But first, the Cloister of Trials. Kimahri? Wakka? Ready?

text.ACTION: [They nod]
[All step onto elevator. Kimahri shoves Tidus off.]

text.Lulu: You're not a guardian yet.

text.Yuna: Um ... We'll be back as soon as we can, okay?

text.ACTION: [Platform descends and returns.]

text.Tidus: Oh, sure! Soon like "tomorrow" soon, I bet!

text.ACTION: [Enter Dona and Barthello.]

text.Tidus: Hey, I'm not a guardian, so I'm not supposed to go in, right?

text.Dona: Hmmm. Not a guardian, you say?

text.ACTION: (Picks up T. and tosses him onto elevator platform)

text.Tidus: Hey! Wait! Ah! Lemme go! Ow! Hey! What's the big idea?

text.ACTION: [Elevator descends]
If Tidus tries to get back on Cloister lift ...

text.Tidus: Come on, go up! Go up!

text.ACTION: [When Tidus decides to go through doors into Cloister ... ]

text.Tidus: Only guardians allowed, and I'm sure no guardian. Well, I guess it's too late now.

text.ACTION: [Solves Cloister of Trials]

text.Wakka: Whoa, whoa, whoa! (Facepalm)

text.Tidus: It was Dona and that big musclehead man!

text.Lulu: Yuna will be the one to suffer the consequences!

text.Wakka: She could be excommunicated!
Just wait.
The fayth, remember?

text.Lulu: The fayth are people who gave their lives to battle Sin. Yevon took their souls, willingly given from their still-living bodies.
Now they live forever, trapped in statues. But when a summoner beckons, the souls of the fayth emerge once again. That's what we call an aeon.

text.Tidus: All that in this room? S-So what's Yuna doing in there?

text.Wakka: She prays with all her heart for a way to defeat Sin.

text.Lulu: The chamber beyond is a sacred place. Only summoners may enter.

text.Wakka: It's taboo!
Just wait.

text.Lulu: (hand on forehead, shakes head)

text.ACTION: [Tidus tries to leave. Inner door opens. Yuna staggers out, tended by Lulu]

text.Tidus:
Narration: There was something I didn’t tell anyone else that day. That song we heard there, in the temple…I knew it from my childhood. It was proof that Spira and Zanarkand were connected somehow. At least to me it was.
Narration: Maybe that’s why, suddenly, I felt like…I just wanted to go home. I tried to say something, to tell them. But the words wouldn’t come.

text.ACTION: [Tidus emerges from temple]

text.Tidus: Narration: I thought I had put my feelings for Zanarkand behind me. But they were there, and they grew inside me, bigger and bigger, till I was just about ready to burst.

text.ACTION: [Leaving temple area, Tidus hangs back]

text.Yuna: What do you want to do?

text.ACTION: [Wakka and Kimahri whirl, Lulu ignores.]
[Tidus approaches Yuna's party on dock]

text.Wakka: Off to Luca at last! The matches start soon as we get there, so rest up on the way, ya?

text.ACTION: [Everyone embarks. Crowd gathers near Yuna on deck, including Wantz. Lulu summons Wakka to top deck. Tidus starts in passengers' cabin with Aurochs and some Goers.]

CHOICE.Datto: Tournament's coming up real soon. I wish we had more time to practice, ya?

CHOICE.Jassu: I just want to sneak up behind them and beat the ... I mean, I wanna get in their faces and show 'em what we're made of!

CHOICE.Letty: Why do we have to be on the same ship as those Lucans anyway?

CHOICE.Botta: Those herbs I bought in Kilika for seasickness are working great, ya?

CHOICE.Keepa: Urgh ... Why do I feel like I'm being watched?

CHOICE.Abus: Looks like our gals are brewing up something back there. I'd be afraid if I were you.

CHOICE.Doram: Hey, that boy in the Aurochs is a cutie.

CHOICE.Balgerda: My, you're kinda cute, too. Wanna have some fun?

CHOICE.ACTION: Note: If you skipped going belowdecks on the S.S. Liki, the cutscene with Tidus discovering chocobos will trigger here instead ...
(Necking with Barthello)

CHOICE.Wakka: Some people can be so rude.

CHOICE.ACTION: [Luzzu and Gatta are guarding back door again ... well, Luzzu is.]

CHOICE.Luzzu: It might not mean much, but good luck in the tournament.

CHOICE.ACTION: (snnnnoooore)

CHOICE.Luzzu: Best to let him sleep.

CHOICE.ACTION: Note: If you skipped going belowdecks on the S.S. Liki, the cutscene with O'aka insulting Tidus' clothes will be triggered now. Otherwise he doesn't speak unless you hit "X" ...

CHOICE.O'aka: They ask a fortune for rags in Besaid. And Kilika, well ... Me business is in shambles! What's an O'aka to do, I ask ye!
Mind spotting me some Gil again, lad?
Right. Figures.
(Disgusted noise) Should've expected as much.
I'll make it up to ye, that I will. Spare some change, lad? (Menu re-opens)

CHOICE.Captain: We're doing double duty on the watch to avoid ending up like the S.S. Liki. Report to us immediately if you see any sign of Sin.

CHOICE.Luzzu: This ship is just a ferry. We're doomed if we run into Sin.

CHOICE.Helmsman: No offense, but I'm a diehard Luca Goers fan. Good luck, pal. You're gonna need it.

CHOICE.Luzzu: Maybe you're better off asking the Goers to coach you.

text.ACTION: [Kimahri and Yuina are on aft deck]

CHOICE.ACTION: If Tidus heads aft before eavesdropping on Wakka and Lulu ...

CHOICE.Tidus: What are you all talking about?

CHOICE.Bickson: Who are you supposed to be?

CHOICE.Graav: Ah, I remember him. Guy from Kilika.
You know, one of the Besaid Aurochs. Said somethin' about winning the cup.

CHOICE.Yuna: Don't call him that!

CHOICE.Bickson: But he is an idiot. They don't got what it takes to win the cup.

CHOICE.Tidus: Well, they do now that I'm here!

CHOICE.Yuna: Yes, they will win! He used to be the star player of the Zanarkand Abes!

CHOICE.ACTION: (snickering)

CHOICE.Bickson: That so? Then you're the star of a team of one.

CHOICE.Graav: Yeah, as if anyone lived in those ruins.

CHOICE.Yuna: It's not ruins, there's a big city there! There is!

CHOICE.Tidus: I-I got too close to Sin and–

CHOICE.Yuna: There is a city, really!

text.ACTION: [Goers go below, Aurochs come on deck.]

text.Tidus: What's wrong? You seemed kinda mad back there.

text.Yuna: They were being rude and ... I do believe your Zanarkand exists. I really do, you know!
Sir Jecht used to always tell me stories. It'd be great to see your home someday. I'd love to go there.

text.Tidus:
Narration: So, Yuna, wanna come over to my place?
Narration: Right, sure… As if I had a place to show her.

text.Lulu: Well? Say something. You'll take responsibility?

text.Wakka: Relax! He's bound to know someone in Luca.

text.Lulu: And if not?

text.Wakka: He could always join a blitz team. Anyhow, it's better than just leaving him in Besaid!

text.Lulu: What? Just leaving him in Luca?

text.Wakka: What do you want me to do?

text.Lulu: Yuna wants to make him a guardian.

text.Wakka: Oh, yeah, geez ... There's that too, eh?

text.Lulu: And whose fault is that?

text.Wakka: Not mine!

text.Lulu: (glares)

text.Wakka: (slumps) It is mine, huh?

text.ACTION: Continuing to eavesdrop ...

text.Wakka: Why do you think she wants to make him a guardian, anyway?

text.Lulu: Because he's Sir Jecht's son.

text.Wakka: Oh, right.
Wait, you sure 'bout that? He's really Sir Jecht's son?

text.Lulu: It's hard to say, but Yuna seems to believe so.

text.Wakka: Okay.

text.Lulu: "Okay?" "Okay?" That's all you have to say?

text.Wakka: Well, yeah, I mean ... He's gotta decide for himself, ya? Well, him and Yuna, I guess.

text.Lulu: You're right, for once.

text.Wakka: Ahem!

text.Lulu: I wonder which is best ...

CHOICE.Lulu: Why don't you tell him he should?

CHOICE.Wakka: Should what?

CHOICE.Lulu: Become Yuna's guardian.

CHOICE.Wakka: Why me?

CHOICE.Lulu: Because Yuna can't.

CHOICE.Wakka: Why not?

CHOICE.Lulu: He hates his father– what he was, what he did. Do you really think she can possibly say to him ... "I want you to be my guardian, like your father was to mine?"

CHOICE.Wakka: Aren't you being over-sensitive?

CHOICE.Lulu: (Huff!)

CHOICE.Wakka: All right, all right. I'll try talking to him after the tournament.

CHOICE.Lulu: Be discreet.

CHOICE.Wakka: I know. It's his decision.
He doesn't like his father?

CHOICE.Lulu: Apparently. He told Yuna as much.

CHOICE.Wakka: Hating your own father, huh? Sounds like a luxury to me. I don't even remember my parents. Can't say how I feel about 'em.

CHOICE.Lulu: I ... I was five then, so I remember mine a little.

CHOICE.Wakka: Dammit! (slams fist on deck)

CHOICE.Lulu: Hm?

CHOICE.Wakka: Sin just takes everything away from us.

CHOICE.ACTION: Afterwards ...

CHOICE.Yuna: I do believe your Zanarkand exists. I really do, you know!

CHOICE.Kimahri: (With repeated poking, he'll uncross his arms, shake his head, and eventually shove Tidus, causing Yuna to giggle and Tidus to backflip).

CHOICE.Lulu: I'm sorry. I need some time to think.

CHOICE.Wakka: Go to bed, bud. Tournament starts tomorrow morning. [As Tidus starts downstairs ... ] Someone's bound to recognize you when they see your moves out there.

CHOICE.Wantz: (runs away from Tidus, snaps more pictures)

text.ACTION: After Bickson & friends head downstairs…

CHOICE.Jassu: We can finally relax now that the Goers are down in the cabin.

CHOICE.Wakka: Don't mind Kimahri for not answering you. He's the silent type, you know?

CHOICE.Datto: Looks like the toxin's still getting to you. Take it easy and go to bed early, ya?

CHOICE.Wakka: We wanted to have our final practice in Kilika, but that's impossible after what happened to the place.

CHOICE.Letty: Wakka is busy right now. Maybe you shouldn't bother him.

CHOICE.Wakka: Let's pray we don't have to go against the Goers until the finals!

CHOICE.Zalitz: The Aurochs are the team to watch this year. They say they got a blitzer from Zanarkand on their team!

CHOICE.Kiyuri: Oh, come on! You actually believe that rumor?

CHOICE.Zalitz: Ha! No way. I only meant it'll be fun to watch.
You're a blitzer from Zanarkand, right? At least put up a good fight, you hear me?

CHOICE.Wakka: That guy poking around back there is taking sphere shots of Lady Yuna.

CHOICE.Kiyuri: Zanarkand, eh ... ? If you're going to bluff at all, say something a little more believable.

CHOICE.Wakka: You've got nerve to say you're from Zanarkand. Go home and relearn Yevon's teachings.

CHOICE.Captain: We have two summoners and the Goers onboard. It is my responsibility to carry them safely to their destination.

CHOICE.Wakka: What, the Besaid Aurochs? They're more like cargo.

CHOICE.Helmsman: You're from Zanarkand? Everyone on the ship's been talking about you.

CHOICE.Wakka: You've got the biggest mouth of any blitzer I've ever seen!

CHOICE.Botta: I-It's terrible! Those Lucans dragged off Keepa! I ... I hope I'm next.

CHOICE.Abus: They say you come from the ruins. Hehehe ... The Aurochs gotta be desperate to depend on some wacko.

CHOICE.Graav: Let's see them moves you've learned in those ruins then!

CHOICE.Bickson: Yo, mister star player from Zanarkand! Take it easy on us today.

CHOICE.Doram: Now, what should we play next?

CHOICE.Balgerda: What? You want to hang out with us? Hmm ... Maybe later.

text.ACTION: [Tidus finds abandoned blitzball on deck]
[Minigame: Tidus tries to learn Jecht Shot]

text.Jecht: No one else can do it.

text.Yuna: (Success) That was the Jecht shot, wasn't it? (Failure) You tried to do a Jecht Shot, didn't you?
Sir Jecht showed it to me when I was a child. He called it the "Sublimely Magnificent Jecht Shot Mark III."

text.Tidus: Stupid name, huh? You know what? There is no Mark I or Mark II, you know? My old man said the name Mark III was just something to hook the crowd. He said they'd come back every night expecting to see Mark I and Mark II. And, they really did come back. I used to get so mad.

text.ACTION: [Long silence]

text.Yuna: I don't know. But, Sir Jecht was my father's guardian.
Yes. So if anything happened to him, I should think word would get around fast.
What would you do, if you found him?

text.Tidus: Who knows? I thought he died ten years ago. Well ... I'd probably just smack him one. After everything he put Mom and me through. And because he was famous, I was always ...
Your father's famous, too. Everyone in Spira knows him, right?

text.Yuna: It is hard to follow in his footsteps, as a summoner.
But the honor of having a father like him surpasses all that, I think.

text.Tidus: Well, there wasn't much to honor about my old man, that's for sure.

text.Yuna: You shouldn't say that about your father!

text.Tidus: Narration: I didn’t think my old man would come to Luca. He never did like watching other people play. But I couldn’t help feeling something bad was gonna happen. And these feelings of mine are usually right. Sure, I had told Wakka I’d help him win the tournament. But I wasn’t sure I had it in me to play at all anymore.

text.ACTION: [Athletes emerge from S.S. Winno accompanied by live broadcast]

text.Bobba: Ah, over there! The ships carrying the players are arriving now! This would be dock number 2. All the way from Kilika, it's the Kilika Beasts! High Summoner Ohalland used to play for them–a big name to live up to. Their hometown was recently attacked by Sin. Isn't that right, Jimma?

text.Jimma: Yes, Bobba. They're going to be pulling out all the stops to try and bring back the cup this year.

text.Bobba: Exciting, isn't it folks? Our next team off the ramp is ... Well, well, well! If it isn't the Besaid Aurochs! They're a living, breathing statistical impossibility! I've never seen a team this bad! That's right! In twenty-three years they've never made it past the first round! Only a few die-hard fans are in the audience today.

text.Jimma: Best of luck to them and a safe journey back to Besaid.

text.Bobba: Right, Jimma. Moving right along, our next team is ... Here they are, folks! Our very own Luca Goers! They've got power! They've got speed! They've got teamwork! They're an all-around first-class team! And they're back home in Luca!

text.Jimma: Without a doubt, they are the favorite this year, Bobba. And after the way they dominated last year, it'd take a miracle for them to lose today.

text.Bobba: You can say that again, Jimma. Look at the crowd, folks! Look at the crowd! Looks like all of Luca has turned out to cheer the Goers on! They know, I know, and you know, folks! The Luca Goers are number one!

text.ACTION: [Besaid islanders assemble on dock]

text.Wakka: It's like this every year, ya? Don't let it bother you.

text.Tidus: (Produces megaphone from ... somewhere ... hops on crates and starts yelling) Stop right there, Goers! You guys are smilin' now, but not for long!

text.Wakka: (Facepalms)

text.Tidus: 'Cause this year, us Aurochs are taking the cup! (Jeering laughter)

text.ACTION: [Tidus gets down and rejoins party]

text.Wakka: What in Yevon's name were you doing up there?

text.Datto: We sure stood out, though! : We were on the sphere! : We were?

text.Letty: We sure stood out, though! : We were on the sphere! : We were?

text.Jassu: We sure stood out, though! : We were on the sphere! : We were?

text.ACTION: [Three people run by ... ]

text.Dock guard: Maester Mika is here! : Already? : The number 3 dock!

text.Pom-pom lady: Maester Mika is here! : Already? : The number 3 dock!

text.Spoony: Maester Mika is here! : Already? : The number 3 dock!

text.Yuna: Maester Mika has arrived, that's what!

text.Lulu: Maester Mika is the leader of all the peoples of Spira. He's come all the way from Bevelle. The tournament is being held to honor his fifty years as Maester.

Let's go.

text.Lulu: Let's go.

Comments during ball machine battle ...

text.Tidus: Hey, we can use this crane!

text.Lulu: It's probably out of power.

text.ACTION: [Defeat ball machine. Just then, Yuna escapes hold, knocking out captor. Lulu hurries over and embraces her.]

text.Lulu: I hope you hurt them.

text.Tidus: There were these Al Bhed that saved my life when I first came to Spira. They took me on their ship, even gave me food. I was kinda hoping this was the same ship. But it's not. I wonder if they're all gone.
Sin came up near us. I made it out okay, but I don't know what happened to their ship.

text.Yuna: Um, was there anyone called Cid on that ship?

text.Tidus: I don't know. They were all speaking that Al Bhed language.

text.Yuna: He's my uncle, but I've never actually met him.

text.Tidus: Wait. So that means you're Al Bhed, too, Yuna?

text.Yuna: On my mother's side, yes. Cid is my mother's brother. He became distant after my mother married. But she told me to seek him out if I ever needed help.

text.Lulu: Don't tell Wakka about Yuna's lineage. The thing about Wakka–he never had much love for the Al Bhed.
I thought I told you not to tell Wakka!
Oh! (Tosses ball lightning as signal)

text.ACTION: [Wakka, looking haggard, sees light shining and smiles, then motions to Aurochs]

text.Bobba: Thirty seconds left! The Aurochs are launching an all-out offensive! A long pass from Letty! It goes through! Oh ... oh ... . He shoots! Goooooal! Unbelievable! The Aurochs win the match 3-2!

text.ACTION: [Wakka coughs and goes limp again]
[Watching tail end of broadcast]

text.Yuna: We did it! We're in the finals!

text.Lulu: Not the most ... graceful win. If it was Chappu, he'd still be standing.

text.Tidus: Hey, aren't you being just a little unfair?

text.Lulu: (Snarls) Excuse me?

text.Tidus: I know I could never take Chappu's place. You're the one who told Wakka that, right, Lulu? And I don't think Wakka would ever try to take Chappu's pl–

text.Lulu: You don't want to finish that sentence.

text.Tidus: Narration: To be honest, I did kind of feel left out, but… It really was the Aurochs’ and Wakka’s show, after all.

text.Bobba: I wonder what's happening? The crowd is going wild!

[Kimahri and Lulu flank Yuna as chaos erupts]

text.Lulu: What's happening?

text.Wakka: Sir Auron!

text.ACTION: [More and more fiends surround them]
[Fast forward to some time after the finals]
[Aurochs facing Wakka, who carries the cup if they won, blitzball if they lost]

text.Wakka: Yuna needs me with her now. I can't be lying around in some bed.
Come on, look sharp! The blitz season just started. Don't make those faces, ya? (Hands trophy or ball to Datto) Well ... See you, boys! You be good.
I can't hear you!
Never liked long goodbyes anyway. Sorry for making you wait, Yuna. I had some promises to keep, ya? From now on, I'm your full-time guardian.

text.Yuna: Then welcome back, Sir Wakka. (Deep Japanese bow) Good to have you with us.

text.Wakka: Heeey. (Holds up hand to stop her, then bows less deeply in return) It's good to be back, ya?
(To Lulu) So, any news on what happened?

text.Lulu: Not really. We don't know where the fiends came from. Maester Mika is safe and sound, thanks to Maester Seymour. That's about it.

text.Yuna: Maester Seymour's aeon ... It was so powerful ...

text.Tidus: Hey you! Don't stand there! All of this is your fault! Gettin' swallowed by Sin! Ending up here in Spira! Not being able to go back to Zanarkand–everything, everything! I'm telling you, it's all your fault!

text.ACTION: [Fade to black. A little later ... ]

text.Tidus: You knew my old man, didn't you?
And you also knew Yuna's father?
Hey, man, there's no way. That's just impossible.

text.Auron: Nothing impossible about it. Jecht, Braska and I ... Together we defeated Sin ten years ago. Then I went to Zanarkand ... where I watched over you. So that one day I could bring you to Spira.

text.Tidus: Why did it have to be me?

text.Auron: It depends on what you mean by "alive." He is no longer human. But then ... I felt something of Jecht, there in that shell ... couldn't you? You must have felt him when you came in contact with Sin.

text.Tidus: (Shouts) No! That's ridiculous! No way! I don't believe you!

text.Auron: But it is the truth. You'll see for yourself. Come with me.
Every story must have an ending.

text.Tidus: I don't care about your stories!

text.Auron: (Unsympathetically) I see. Sorry you feel that way. Fine, then. Come or don't come. It's your decision.

text.Tidus: (More shouting) RRrrraaaaaaghhh! What am I supposed to say!? You tell me it's my decision ... But I don't have a choice, do I? You're the only one who can tell me what's going on, anyways! I have to go with you! I have to!

text.Auron: Irritating, I know. Or are you afraid?
(Sets a hand on his shoulder, speaks more gently) It's all right.

text.Tidus: Will I ever go home? Back to Zanarkand?

text.Auron: I'm going to offer my services to Yuna. Come.

text.Yuna: Thank you. (She glances back towards Sir Auron, who nods.)

text.Clasko: Take that road to the command center. it's not far. We're still in the midst of preparations this way. Sorry.

CHOICE.O'aka: Good day, lad! Sneaked past the guards, I did! Be makin' a fortune with "Operation Mi'ihen" prices! But you, lad, you get a discount! I owes ya one, eh? Welcome to O'aka's!

CHOICE.ACTION: If you try to run past Clasko ...

CHOICE.Clasko: No, not this way, that way. I guess I'm not good at explaining.

CHOICE.Crusader in green: There is increasing fiend activity. This may not be much help, but ... Yevon's emblem bears mystic powers. Step onto the platform, and you shall see.

CHOICE.Crusader in purple: A summoner's entourage! Please accept this. After the operation, my compadres and I are heading straight to Luca. It's gonna be a blast. We've already reserved a place and everything. Do you think Yevon will take us back in if we succeed?

CHOICE.Lucil: We've been expecting you. Please proceed to the command center. The presence of a maester and a summoner is great for the troops' morale– myself included. Thank you for being here, my lady. Depending on the way things turn out, we might suffer casualties. In such an event, we would be grateful if you could perform the sending, my lady. We may have to fight here, as well. Stay alert.

CHOICE.Shelinda: In the end, I wasn't able to stop them, as you can see. But seeing their fierce determination, I couldn't just sit there. So I decided that I would do everything in my power to help them.
Truly, I know nothing of the ways of fighting, but I do know some white magic. I'm hoping that will be of some use to them.
Is there anything I can do to help you?

CHOICE.Elma: Lady Summoner! What are you doing here? Well, with your guardians near you shouldn't have anything to worry about. Don't say we shouldn't be using machina! Not now, please? I hope Captain Lucil notices my efforts in this mission!

CHOICE.Crusader in purple: Give this to the lady summoner, and grant us your help when the time comes. The command center is strategically located on a ledge overlooking the sea. It's just beyond the artillery base up ahead. We have neutralized all fiends around the command center. The sector is secure.
Be sure to make thorough preparations. Here, put this to good use.
We've concentrated our forces along the coast to prevent Sin from reaching land. We plan to stage a frontal assault. The men are preparing for the worst.
My friend is stationed there. All I can do is pray for him.
We've secured the command center perimeter. But please take this as a precaution.
This is a mechanical lift built by the Al Bhed. Please take it up to the command center.
Relying on machines goes against the teachings, but the maester just used it.

CHOICE.Gatta: Why only you, sir? I want to fight, too! : Order are orders. Gatta: I'm not a cadet anymore, sir! Let me go with you, and I'll prove it to them! Luzzu: Guarding the command center is important too, you know. But I came all the way from Besaid to fight Sin, sir! Luzzu: I know, but an order's an order. To your post, Crusader. But, sir! (Growls and dashes off)

CHOICE.Luzzu: Why only you, sir? I want to fight, too! : Order are orders. Gatta: I'm not a cadet anymore, sir! Let me go with you, and I'll prove it to them! Luzzu: Guarding the command center is important too, you know. But I came all the way from Besaid to fight Sin, sir! Luzzu: I know, but an order's an order. To your post, Crusader. But, sir! (Growls and dashes off)
They let you through, huh?

CHOICE.Wakka: At least there's no chance he'll get hurt. Why are you guys fighting, anyway? Aren't the almighty Al Bhed machina enough?

CHOICE.Luzzu: They still need some time to get them ready. Our job is to keep Sin at bay till they're done.

CHOICE.Wakka: (Snarl, mutter)

CHOICE.Luzzu: Wakka ... I might not get another chance to say this. It's about your brother.

CHOICE.Lulu: Luzzu, no!

CHOICE.Wakka: (Turns and peers at both of them) What?

CHOICE.Luzzu: I'm the one who convinced him ... to enlist.

CHOICE.ACTION: [Wakka rumbles, looks at Lu, who drops her eyes.]

CHOICE.Luzzu: I'm sorry.

CHOICE.Wakka: (Glowers for a long moment, then decks him)
When we used to play blitz together, Chappu used to say ... He'd say that–when we won the Cup, ya?–he'd propose to Lulu. And then one day ... he goes off and becomes a Crusader. Just like that.

CHOICE.Luzzu: Chappu also said to me ... That being with your girl is good ... But keeping Sin far away from her is better.

CHOICE.Wakka: Lu, you knew?

CHOICE.Lulu: (Sigh) Luzzu told me ... before we left.

CHOICE.Luzzu: (Chuckles) She hit me too.

CHOICE.ACTION: [Lucil rides by]

CHOICE.Lucil: All Crusaders in the vanguard are to assemble on the beach!

CHOICE.Luzzu: That's my cue.

CHOICE.Wakka: Luzzu! Don't die out there.

CHOICE.Luzzu: So you can hit me more?

CHOICE.Wakka: Lots! Lots more!

CHOICE.Yuna: (Bars his way) Sir Luzzu, please! Please, don't go!

CHOICE.Luzzu: I have to, Yuna.

CHOICE.Auron: Let him go. The man has already chosen his path ... As you did when you became a summoner.

CHOICE.Yuna: (Steps aside reluctantly)

CHOICE.Tidus: Narration: It would be a long time…before I ever really understood the reason why Yuna let Luzzu pass that day.

text.ACTION: [Take lift up to bluffs, where cannons are pointed towards sea.]

text.Wakka: Curse these ... ! (Kicks cannon) OW!

text.Lulu: Chappu ... He left the sword Wakka gave him in Besaid. And he fought with an Al Bhed machina weapon instead.

text.Wakka: That's got nothing to do with it! I just hate these sacrilegious contraptions!

text.ACTION: Talking to Crusaders and Al Bhed outside command center ...

text.Kyou: The cannon got out of place when we fired a test shot. Packed too much powder, I guess. I have to set her in place before the operation.

CHOICE.Spiked-hair Al Bhed: I will be the one to finish Sin off. We will use the ancient machina to destroy Sin. The Yevon fools will soon witness the power of the Al Bhed.

CHOICE.Artillery Crusader: Once Sin emerges from the sea, we'll commence firing. Our shots should stun it long enough for the Al Bhed machina to finish it off. We just fired a test shot, and this puppy roars! It near knocked me out. Heck, it probably echoed as far as Luca! Sin's gonna be a huge target. We probably won't even have to aim.

text.ACTION: [Yuna's party watches final preparations, including Crusaders herding Sinspawn into cage]

text.Wakka: Grrr ... It won't work anyway.

text.Yuna: Don't say that. It might be a hopeless campaign, and it might mean defying Yevon ... But the Crusaders and the Al Bhed– they're doing their best to defeat Sin. They want to rid Spira of Sin forever. And that's just what we want, too, isn't it?

text.Wakka: Hmph! All right, all right! But I still think machina are bad news. They're forbidden for a reason!

text.Lucil: Lady Summoner! There you are! The command center is that way. Maester Kinoc is also there.

text.Female Crusader in gray: That merchant's obviously ripping people off. I guess it can't be helped. He's the only game out here. I asked him for a discount, and do you know what he said to me? "Ye gonna die anyway, so what's the point?" I wonder what that merchant's gonna do when the battle starts. pacing in front of soldiers: We're only moments away from commencing Operation Mi'ihen. Spira's fate hangs on the outcome of this mission. We will do our duty as soldiers and defeat Sin this day! Soldiers: (Salute) Sir! Captain: It's important to spur my men on every now and then. Maybe I should give them another pep talk to be sure ... : Man, you'd think he'd shut up after five times–or was that six? : The captain just keeps repeating himself. He must be really nervous. : We're inspecting the weapons right now. They're Al Bhed machina, so we have to be extra cautious. So far so good. I'm gonna run more tests. and fighting: -Come on! Swing like a man! Do you wanna avenge your sister or don't you? -I'm gonna beat Sin! I'm gonna beat it! I'm gonna beat it no matter what! -Okay, come on now! Pretend I'm a fiend! -Die, die, die! : I'm short on various stuff, so I'm trying to buy them now. Everything seems a bit pricier than usual. Well, I guess I should just be thankful. I never imagined I could buy stuff out here. Time to shop! Outside Command Center O'aka: Monopoly's a great thing! Things are sellin' no matter what the price! Oops! Sorry, I forgot. Welcome to O'aka's! by command center: Yeah? What do you wanna know? About the cannons. The Al Bhed provided us with these cannons at no charge. I hate the bastards, but I've got a little respect for them now. These cannons have good range. We'll give Sin a shower it won't soon forget! About the Chocobo Knights. Only a select few can become Chocobo Knights. You have to be a skilled rider or achieve some combat merit to become one. Captain Lucil is no doubt the best of the bunch right now. I just don't know how that wimp Clasko got knighted. Well, he is good at earning their trust–the chocobos, that is. About this operation. We've researched Sin's past behaviors in planning this operation. Sin often turns up where its sinspawn are. So we hunted down the sinspawn at various places and brought them here to lure it. When it shows up, we're gonna hit it with the ancient machina, and it's bye-bye Sin. The Crusaders' responsibility is to lure Sin and immobilize it. The Al Bhed will deliver the finishing blow. I wish it could be the other way around, but as long as we defeat Sin, who cares. Never mind.
